answers.author: Edward Chew
answers.text:
International Association of Cheifs of Police hosts an on-line course which seems to fit what you're trying to do. Here's a link to the specific training:  http://policecommunity.net/distance_learning/cs 
There is a cost for the on-line course and you'll have to contact IACP for further info. 
Here's the main training page...
http://theiacp.org/LeadershipandTraining/OnlineTraining/tabid/924/Default.aspx

answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found some resources you may find helpful. 
Sacramento has partnered with corporations known for their customer service to help improve the police department. You may want to contact them directly for more information on their course.
http://www.emergencymgmt.com/training/Sacramento-Calif-Police-Training.html
The New South Wales Police Force also created a Customer Service Program. 
http://policing.oxfordjournals.org/content/4/3/249.abstract
Union City, CA has created a five-year police plan with improvements to customer service listed as one of the goals they are working on. 
http://www.union-city.ca.us/police/pd_pdfs/Strategic%20Plan-Final.pdf
I have also included an article from Police One about customer service programs that have been used by police departments.
http://www.policeone.com/police-products/training/books-training-materials/articles/2716600-Customer-service-in-law-enforcement-revisited/
The articles below discuss general practices to improve customer service training.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3225/Customer_Service_Back_to_Basics_Is_Better
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6539/Recognizing_the_Emotion_Work_of_Public_Service
This document details the Arlington, VA CARE’s customer service program.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14817/Overview_of_Arlington_CAREs
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Shannon Bell-Logan
text:
Our community is requiring customer service training for all of our employees.  The curriculum is basic, and we are trying to revise it to match the requirements for police officers and the concepts of community policing.  Does anyone have any outlines, training material suggestions, resources, etc.., on how we might be able to teach customer service to police officers during a four-hour training course?  It seems to be a popular concept across the country, and we would be grateful for any help with the curriculum. 
thank you!
title: Community Policing and Customer Service
